alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Orange; Osceola; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:42PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seminole, southwestern Orange, south central Volusia and northwestern Osceola Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 342 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Jessup to Conway to near Poinciana. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Deltona, Kissimmee, Sanford and Altamonte Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
